intro.p: Suppose the function p(x) satisfies p({{a}}) = {{La}}, p'({{a}}) = {{Lpa}}, and p''(x) {{concavity_ineq}} 0 for x values nearby {{a}}.

content.p: Explain and demonstrate how to find the linearization L(x) of p(x) at x ={{a}}.
Explain and demonstrate how to estimate the value of p({{adx}}) using this linearization.
Explain why your estimate of p({{adx}}) is greater than or less than the actual value.

outtro.p: The estimate is {{concavity_word}} than the actual value.

content.p: Sketch a possible graph of p(x) and its linearization L(x) nearby x ={{a}} to illustrate your findings.
